original_title: Sri Lanka budget support IMF loan for debt repayment or rupee expenses
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s budget support loan from the International Monetary Fund can be used either for debt repayment or rupee expenses, Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.
“The government receives dollars to their account,” Governor Weerasinghe explained.  “If they have debt service in foreign currency debt service, they can use it directly without converting.
“Anything remaining they can sell to the central bank, take rupees and spend for local expenditure.”
Sri Lanka has already used a part of the IMF money to settle an Indian credit given after the country defaulted.
In the past central bank received IMF funds directly into its balance sheet to build reserves without disturbing reserve money or triggering any liquidity shocks. The central bank was the borrower.
“This time the borrowers is the government,” Governor Weerasinghe said. “We have signed what is called a tri-partite agreement.
“It has to be serviced through the central bank, but the government is the borrower.” (Colombo/Apr05/2023)
